alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:34AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rain will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, northern Gates, and northwestern Currituck Counties, the City of Norfolk, the City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth, the eastern City of Suffolk, the City of Virginia Beach, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 745 AM EDT... At 633 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from Norfolk NAS to near Sunbury. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ocean View, Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Portsmouth, Norfolk NAS, Fort Monroe, Norview and Ghent around 640 AM EDT. Virginia Wesleyan University and Norfolk International around 645 AM EDT. Norfolk around 650 AM EDT. Virginia Beach and Morgans Corner around 715 AM EDT. South Mills around 720 AM EDT. Northwest around 735 AM EDT. Moyock around 745 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Norfolk, Horseshoe, Rudee Heights, Portlock, Pierceville, Princess Anne Plaza, Savage, Sigma, Suffolk Airport and Huntersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach
